dataset.name: diabetes_selfmanagement_information_standard
dataset.description:
Version incremented from 0.1 to 0.2 following review by assurance committee.

Version incremented from 0.2 to 0.3. Implementation Guidance added.  Implementation Guidance added. Name changed from Diabetes Self-management Data Standard to Diabetes Self-Management Information Standard for ISN. Post-endorsement and phase 2 changes to model and implementation guidance detailed in changes log. 

Implementation guidance
1. Introduction

 1.1 Purpose of this implementation guidance

This implementation guidance provides guidance to support the implementation of the PRSB Diabetes Self-Management Information Standard. General guidance is provided here. Data item specific implementation guidance can be found under the 'context' field. PRSB has carried out a clinical safety review in accordance with DCB0129, which is detailed in the clinical safety case and accompanying Diabetes Information Standards hazard log. This guidance should be used in conjunction with the Risk Mitigation section. This guidance should be used in conjunction with the final report for the Diabetes Information Standards.

1.2 Audience
This guidance is intended for anyone implementing and using the PRSB Diabetes Self-Management Information Standard. This will include health and social care professionals, IT system suppliers, developers, and implementers. 

1.3 Definition and scope of the Diabetes Self-Management Information Standard

1.3.1 What the diabetes self-management information standard is:

  • A definition of the information that a person with diabetes may collect as part of self-management of their condition to share with healthcare professionals (depending on their role and circumstances) to support the person's direct care including data and summary metrics from diabetes devices.
  • A definition of the information relevant to diabetes self-management professionals and people with diabetes have told us that they want shared to support their direct care needs.
  • For use across the four nations of the UK by people with all types of diabetes mellitus (except 'prediabetes').
  • For sharing information relevant to the self-management of adults and children with diabetes.
  • A base standard. This will require further development of implementable profiles for the various use cases covered e.g., sharing of information for specific types of diabetes devices such as real-time continuous glucose monitors (rtCGM) or ambulatory insulin pumps.
  • A thoroughly researched definition of information relevant to diabetes self-management tested with people with diabetes and their carers, healthcare professionals and systems and diabetes device suppliers.
  • Supported by a robust clinical safety case.
1.3.2 What the diabetes self-management information standard is not:
  • An exhaustive definition of the information that may need to be shared.
  • A definition of how the information (including numerical data from devices) should be presented to the person viewing it (e.g.  Features/ content of graphical displays/ summary dashboards or clinical decision support systems including electronic alerts).
  • A definitive set of information about the person's current status - no set of clinical information is ever this and the information shared needs to be understood by the professional reading it as such.
  • A prescriptive definition of what must be included in a message - this will be determined ultimately by specific use cases including capabilities of diabetes apps, applications and devices. 
  • A definition of a diabetes self-management record.
  • A definition of the source data and its processing, including how the content should be sourced, updated, deduplicated, normalised or calculated in practice (e.g. insulin or glucose summary metrics from data reported by the person or from diabetes devices). Calculations described within this implementation guidance are included for illustrative purposes to help understanding. 
  • A definition of how the data should be stored. However, implementation of the standard should comply with relevant national NHS data sharing policies and standards including the Digital Technology Assessment Criteria (DTAC) (see https://www.nhsx.nhs.uk/key-tools-and-info/digital-technology-assessment-criteria-dtac/).
2. General guidance

2.1 Structure of the Diabetes Self-Management Information Standard explained
The information standard is organised into sections made up of several data (information) elements, with record entries and clusters (subsections) to support repeated sets of information and grouping of related items. 

The set of rules and instructions governing the type of information expected within a section, cluster, record entry and element and how it is communicated is defined in the information model under the titles of Description, Cardinality, Conformance and Valuesets. 

The Diabetes Self-Management Information Standard contains the following information components as outlined below:
  • Section │ A section groups together all the information related to a specific topic e.g. ‘Medications and medical devices’ and ‘Person demographics’. It is the highest level to logically group data elements that may be independent or related. For example, ‘Medications and medical devices’ includes sets of related elements with dependencies between the elements whereas 'Social context' includes a set of independent elements or information items, grouped in a logical section.
  • Record entry │ A record entry within a section is used where a set of information is repeated for a particular item, and there can be multiple items. For example, for each medication administered there is a set of information associated with that medication. 
  • Cluster │ This is a set of elements put together as a group and which relate to each other │ For example,  'Insulin calculations cluster', which is the set of elements used to calculate a particular mealtime or correction bolus dose of insulin.
  • Element │ The data item. An element can appear in one or more sections. │ For example, 'Medication name', 'Device type'.
The Diabetes Self-Management Information Standard has the following rules and instructions as outlined below:
  • Description │ This is the description of the section, record entry, cluster or element.  For an element, it describes the information that the element should contain in as plain English as possible.
  • Cardinality │ Each section, record entry, cluster and element will have a statement of cardinality. This clarifies how many entries can be made i.e. zero, one or many entries. The number of records expected and allowed are displayed as: 0……* = zero to many record entries are allowed; 0……1 = zero to one record entry is allowed; 1……1 = one record is expected; 1……* = one to many records are expected. For example, the ‘Medications and medical devices’ section may have zero to many medication item records in it and is displayed as 0…… *.    
  • Conformance │ Conformance defines what information is ‘mandatory’, ‘required’ or ‘optional’ and applies to sections, record entries, clusters and elements. The IT system must be developed to be handle all the information elements that are defined in the Standard but not all the information is required for every individual record or information transfer. The following set of rules apply to enable implementers to cater for the end users (senders and receivers) requirements: Mandatory – the information must be included; Required – if it exists, the information must be included; Optional – a local decision is made as to whether the information is included. These rules apply at all levels and give the flexibility to allow local clinical or professional decisions on some information that is included, while being clear on what is important information to include. For example, a person subject to a referral may have many assessments, but not all of these will be relevant to the referral. NB: It is permitted to upgrade a conformance rule but not to down grade one. For instance, a section that is classed as optional in the standard can be upgraded to required or mandatory in local implementations. However, one that is classed mandatory or required cannot be downgraded to required or optional. 
  • Valuesets │ Valuesets describe precisely how the information is recorded in the system and communicated between systems. This is required for interoperability (for information to flow between one IT system and another).  The information can be text, multi-media or in a coded format. If coded it can be constrained to SNOMED CT and specific SNOMED CT reference sets, NHS Data Dictionary values or other code sets.
2.2 How we expect the Diabetes Self-Management Information Standard to be used

What is defined is a set of information that covers a broad range of what can be shared relating to diabetes self-management. How this information is transferred to (e.g. via the cloud) and stored in a person's electronic health record for diabetes is out of scope. It is recognised that different local implementations across settings may differ in their level of digital maturity. For example some systems may not be capable, at least at first, of storing/ processing raw data from diabetes devices or platforms (and using this to calculate and display derived summary statistics). It may be that in such cases initial 'simpler' implementations may preferentially send and receive pre-calculated metrics and preformed graphical representations of the data for display to the end-user (e.g. Ambulatory Glucose Profiles (AGPs) shared as PDFs) with a view to progressing to more complex/ sophisticated implementations later. Not all the information defined in the standard will be relevant for every use case. Further work will need to define different ‘views’ focusing on the information sharing requirements of different use cases (e.g. defining what information contained in the standard is and is not required for insulin pumps, connected insulin pens, continuous glucose monitors etc.).

There is a complex environment of systems and technology to support diabetes that need to share information and will need to conform with the information and technical standards to do so. There are four broad groups of systems and technology increasing from the micro to macro level for example an app, a device, a local management system at ICS level though to a regional or national system:

a.     lifestyle apps for supported self-management.

b.     medical devices (including self-monitoring and insulin delivery devices, Point of Care systems in hospitals and systems integrating data from devices e.g. Glooko)

c.     specialist diabetes management systems (e.g. My Way Diabetes Health, Hicom’s Diamond and Twinkle).

d.     non-diabetes specific health and care record and electronic prescribing and medications administration systems (e.g. Cerner Millenium, Epic, EMIS, TPP SystmOne, Graphnet, Orion, Patient Centred Software, Nourish).

In order for information to be shared between these systems they may need to be adapted to ensure that the information is structured and coded in alignment with the standards. 


2.3 Dependencies

The implementation of PRSB Diabetes Self-Management Information Standard is dependent on the following:

  • The national and local Information Governance frameworks which will need to determine information access and sharing controls and legitimate relationships between proprietary systems and health and care provider organisations.
  • Technical messaging standards e.g. FHIR profiles (to support the transfer of information between systems).
  • The ability to safely link and share the information recorded by the person or their devices (initially onto proprietary apps, applications or other systems) with the person's electronic health record. How this is done is yet to be determined/ clarified with suppliers but may require integration with the person demographics service API where there is a legal basis to do so (see https://digital.nhs.uk/services/demographics) or other secure methods.
  • The parallel deployment of the PRSB Provenance Data Standard to ensure that critical contextual information (e.g. where and when the procedure, measurement or recording etc was done and by whom or what device) is shared with the message. 

2.4 Risk mitigation
We recommend system suppliers and local implementers apply further risk mitigations when implementing the PRSB Diabetes Self-Management Information Standard by addressing the risks that have been flagged in the clinical safety case report and hazard log for the standard.  Suppliers and implementers should aim to reduce the risk scores to 2, or better, when carrying out clinical risk assessments and developing safety cases for their implementations with respect to DCB0129 and DCB0160.

2.5 Information governance

Sound principles of information governance and respecting the privacy of people and their information is paramount. NHS England has published a national Information Governance Framework  that needs to be considered when planning implementation. Local agreements should be drawn up between organisations to define information requirements for communication.

2.6 Data quality

Data quality and accuracy of coded data entry should be managed in local ‘source’ systems to ensure that information shared with people and professionals through other systems is dependent on the source data quality.   

2.7 Context of the information (see also Provenance Data Standard)

It is vital for use of the data that all contextual information is maintained and should not be lost on exchange or import of information. For example, a person with diabetes self-managing their condition at home may record their own blood pressure or conduct self-monitoring of blood glucose (SMBG). They may also be using diabetes devices including CGM, connected insulin pens or ambulatory insulin pumps. In all cases it is important that the full context of the information is known (where and when the measurement was done and by whom or what device). The principle, for PRSB standards, is that for clinical safety and efficacy of communications, the key contextual data described within the PRSB Provenance Data Standard should be shared with the message as instructed in the Diabetes Self-Management Information Standard. The principle applied in the information model is that where it is important (from a professional perspective) to know who or what device undertook the activity and who or what device recorded the that this is made available to the end-user of the receiving system. For every item of information shared it is important that an audit trail is recorded (even if not explicitly stated in the information model). This is set out below (see time stamp and audit trail). 

2.8 Provenance Data Standard
Implementation of the Diabetes Self-Management Information Standard requires use of the PRSB Provenance Data Standard. See Provenance data – PRSB (theprsb.org).

2.9 Time stamp and audit trail

It is important that an audit trail is recorded for every item of information recorded or shared (even if not explicitly stated in the information model). Each record entry will need to be time stamped from the source system with date and time recorded and the identity of the person making the record. This needs to be viewable in the records themselves where appropriate and via a full audit trail which may be viewable by the end user to enhance transparency.

2.10 Links to other systems and records

Effective use of the Diabetes Self-Management Information Standard will require the ability to safely link and share the information recorded by the person or their devices (initially onto proprietary apps, applications or other systems) with the person's electronic health record. How this is done is yet to be determined/ clarified with suppliers but may require integration with the person demographics service API where there is a legal basis to do so (see https://digital.nhs.uk/services/demographics) or other secure methods.

2.11 Coding

The Personalised Health and Care 2020 framework for action  ( https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/personalised - health - and - care - 2020 ) recommends the use of SNOMED CT and the dictionary of medicines and devices (dm+d). Local decisions need to be made about when these codes are to be used, depending on local system functionality and plans. The current ambition is for SNOMED CT and dm+d to be the primary clinical coding schemes in use in the NHS. 

2.12 Accessibility

The design of user interfaces for health and care record systems should follow guidance for specific PRSB standards and should comply with the NHS England Accessible Information Standard ( https://www.england.nhs.uk/ourwork/accessibleinfo/ ) . This sets out the rules for accessible patient information in patient literature and clinical systems.

2.13 PRSB Support

The PRSB support service is available for any help, enquiries or issues with the using or implementing the standards. Any feedback on the standard (including proposed changes) resulting from putting the standard into practice would also be welcome. Contact is via support@theprsb.org or Tel: 02045515225.

Version incremented from 0.3 to 1.0 following end-endorsement phase. br clear="none"/>

concept.name: person_demographics
concept.description: The person's details and contact information.

concept.name: person_name
concept.description: Details of the person's name

concept.name: person_first_name
concept.description: The first name(s) of the person. This includes middle names.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :- Person given name

concept.name: person_family_name
concept.description: The family name or surname of the person
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary : - Person family name

concept.name: person_full_name
concept.description: The full name of the person in text representation.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :- Person full name

concept.name: date_of_birth
concept.description: The date of birth of the person.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary:- Person birth date

concept.name: nhs_number
concept.description: The unique identifier for a person within the NHS in England and Wales.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary:- NHS number

concept.name: other_identifier
concept.description: Country specific or local identifier, e.g. Community Health Index (CHI) in Scotland.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary: - Local patient identifier(extended), Health and care number (NI only), Community health index number (Scotland only)

concept.name: persons_address
concept.description: Person’s usual place of residence, and where relevant temporary and correspondence addresses.

concept.name: address_line_1
concept.description: Person's first line of address.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :-  Address line 1

concept.name: address_line_2
concept.description: Person's second line of address.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :- Address line 2

concept.name: address_line_3
concept.description: Person's third line of address.

concept.name: address_line_4
concept.description: Person's fourth line of address.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary : - Address line 4

concept.name: address_line_5
concept.description: Person's fifth line of address.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary : - Address line 5

concept.name: postcode
concept.description: The person's postcode.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :- Postcode of usual address

concept.name: address_type
concept.description: The type of address e.g. Main address, Temp address
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :- Address Association Type

concept.name: persons_contact_details
concept.description: Details of the person's contact information.

concept.name: persons_email_address_details
concept.description: Details of the person's email address

concept.name: persons_email_address
concept.description: Email address of the person.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary:- Contact Email Address

concept.name: about_me
concept.description: About me

concept.name: what_is_most_important_to_me
concept.description: A description of what is most important to you.

concept.name: what_is_most_important_to_me
concept.description:
A description of what is most important to you.
 
Emergency Information : - Include any essential information that any professional in health and social care should know about the you in any situation, including emergencies.
 
Other Information : -This could include : - Values, Spirituality/religion, Ethnicity, Culture, Pets, Goals and aspirations, Meaningful activities including leisure activities, visiting places, sport and exercise, listening to music, employment, education, volunteering.

concept.name: people_who_are_important_to_me
concept.description: Details of who is important to you and why.

concept.name: people_who_are_important_to_me
concept.description:
Details of who is important to you and why. They could be family members, carers, friends, members of staff etc. Include how you want the people important to you to be engaged and involved in your care and support in both emergency and normal situations. Include how you stay connected to the people important to you. Who should not be contacted or
                            consulted about your care and support and why, if you wish to say

concept.name: how_i_communicate_and_how_to_communicate_with_me
concept.description: A description of how you communicate normally.

concept.name: how_i_communicate_and_how_to_communicate_with_me
concept.description:
A description of how you communicate normally including any communication aids you use, for example a hearing aid.

  • Include your preferred language of communication, if your first language is not English.
  • Include how you would communicate when you are in pain or distress.
  • Include how you communicate choices.
  • Include how you give feedback or raise a concern.
  • Include how you like to receive information

Describe how you would like others to engage and communicate with you, including how you would like to be addressed.

concept.name: my_wellness
concept.description: A description covering what you are able to do, how you engage with others and how you feel on a typical day through to on a day when you are unwell or really unwell.

concept.name: my_wellness
concept.description:
A description covering what you are able to do, how you engage with others and how you feel on a typical day through to on a day when you are unwell or really unwell

  • Include any causes that might result in you becoming unwell and strategies for avoiding or addressing the causes. For example, not drinking enough water could cause constipation.
  • Include any signs that indicate you might be becoming unwell.
  • On a bad day describe what is different about what you are able to do, how you engage with others and how you feel.
  • Include how your everyday life is affected by any medical conditions e.g. dementia and any symptoms e.g. itchiness, cough, pain and how you manage those conditions.
  • Include past health issues or experiences that need to be considered
  • Include your wellbeing and lifestyle goals and aspirations

concept.name: please_do_and_please_dont
concept.description: A description of things you want someone supporting you to do (or not to do).

concept.name: please_do_and_please_dont
concept.description:
A description of things you want someone supporting you to do (or not to do).
Things you want someone to do might include (for example): - Talk to me not to my carer, remind me to take my medication, encourage me to wash my hands regularly, explain to me what is happening and why, respond to my communication.
A description of things you do not want someone supporting you to do might include (for example): - Discussing or asking questions about certain topics, making assumptions about something, providing support when it is not wanted, talking to you in a certain way, undergoing a specific intervention or taking a medication the person does not want.

concept.name: how_and_when_to_support_me
concept.description: A description of how and when you want someone caring for you to support you.

concept.name: how_and_when_to_support_me
concept.description:
A description of how and when you want someone caring for you to support you.

  • This could include support needs in an emergency situation (for example taking blood)
  • This could include support you need to maintain important routines or to carry out particular activities, for example: - Personal care routines, Eating and drinking, Bedtime routines, Taking medications, Moving and transitioning
  • This could also include support needed with:- wearing glasses/hearing aids/false teeth etc, making informed choices or understanding dangers and risks, managing your emotions, moods and behaviours, memory or confusion.
  • Include how your support needs change in different environments. Include any triggers that might result in you needing further support and strategies for avoiding or addressing the triggers. Include how you want the support to be provided.

concept.name: also_worth_knowing_about_me
concept.description: A description of what is also worth knowing about you for people caring or supporting you.

concept.name: also_worth_knowing_about_me
concept.description:
A description of what is also worth knowing about you for people caring or supporting you.

  • This could include a short history of your life (where you have worked, where you lived, important events in your life, important people in your past life).
  • This could include a short profile of your current life:- your work / study, your aspirations, your skills, your networks, things you like e.g. particular foods, places, a football team and things you like to talk about, things you dislike
  • This could also include any care and support preferences that have not been included elsewhere.

concept.name: date
concept.description: This is a record of the date that this information was last updated.

concept.name: supported_to_write_this_by
concept.description: Where relevant, this is a record of name, relationship/role and contact details of the individual who supported the person to write this section e.g. carer, family member, advocate, professional.

concept.name: location_to_multimedia_file
concept.description: The link to the person's multimedia file

concept.name: social_context
concept.description: The social setting in which the person lives, such as their household, occupational history, and lifestyle factors.

concept.name: smoking_status
concept.description: Details of the person's smoking status.

concept.name: smoking_status
concept.description: Record of any smoking use by the person.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The smoking status of the person.
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT:- ^999000891000000102 |Smoking simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)|

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: smoking_status__details
concept.description: Further details recorded about the smoking status of the person

concept.name: alcohol_intake
concept.description: Details of the person's alcohol intake

concept.name: alcohol_intake
concept.description: Latest or current alcohol consumption.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value of the person alcohol intake
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT :- <<219006 |Current drinker of alcohol (finding)| OR <<105542008 |Current non-drinker of alcohol (finding)| OR 783261004 |Lifetime non-drinker of alcohol (finding)| OR 1104551000000109 |Declined to provide information about alcohol use (situation)| OR 371434005 |History of alcohol abuse (situation)|

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: examination_findings
concept.description: Examination findings

concept.name: examination_findings_record_entry
concept.description: This is an examination findings record entry. There may be 0 to many record entry/entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.

concept.name: examination_type
concept.description: The type of examination performed.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for examination type.

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: examination_findings
concept.description: The record of findings from the examinations performed.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for examination findings.
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT : - ^1127601000000107 |Healthcare matters simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)|

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no coded text available

concept.name: body_site
concept.description: The body site of the examination finding.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for body site.

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: laterality
concept.description: The laterality of the examination finding (left or right or bilateral).

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for laterality.

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: severity
concept.description: The severity of the examination finding.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for severity.

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: observations
concept.description: The record of essential physiological measurements, e.g., heart rate, blood pressure, temperature, pulse, height, weight, respiratory rate, oxygen saturation.

concept.name: observations_record_entry
concept.description: This is an observations record entry. There may be 0 to many record entry/entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.

concept.name: device_type
concept.description: The device type.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for device type.

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for observations
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT: - <363787002 | Observable entity (observable entity) |

concept.name: value
concept.description: The measured value of the observations
concept.valueSets: Enumerated value e.g. numeric, natural numbers, mild, moderate

concept.name: units_of_measure
concept.description: The units of measure for the observation.

concept.name: site
concept.description: The anatomical site at which the observation is taken
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT: - <442083009 | Anatomical or acquired body structure (body structure) |

concept.name: interpretation
concept.description: The assessment made based on the result of the observation e.g high, low

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: comment
concept.description: Any additional comment or clarification about the observation.

concept.name: manually_entered
concept.description: A flag to indicate whether the observation was entered manually by the user.

concept.name: summary_observations
concept.description: Summary observations. This includes calculated summary metrics.

concept.name: glucose_metrics_record_entry
concept.description: This is a glucose metrics record entry. There may be 0 to many record entry/entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.

concept.name: reporting_period
concept.description: The reporting period for the glucose data sample.

concept.name: start_date
concept.description: The start date and time of the data sample period.

concept.name: end_date
concept.description: The end date and time of the data sample period.

concept.name: monitoring_type
concept.description: Details of monitoring devices used to measure glucose observations.

concept.name: device_type
concept.description: The device type.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for device type.

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: monitoring_detail
concept.description: Details of the glucose monitoring procedure.

concept.name: mean_daily_monitoring_frequency
concept.description: The average number of glucose measurements per day during the reporting period.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for mean daily monitoring frequency.

concept.name: value
concept.description: The value of mean daily monitoring frequency.

concept.name: percent_sensor_data_available
concept.description: The sensor data available as a percentage of that expected during the reporting period.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for percent sensor data available.

concept.name: value
concept.description: The value of percent sensor data available.

concept.name: units_of_measure
concept.description: The units of measure for percent sensor data available.

concept.name: percent_number_of_sensor_failures
concept.description: The number of continuous glucose monitoring sensor failures reported by the person, expressed as a percentage of sensors applied during the reporting period.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for percent number of sensor failures.

concept.name: value
concept.description: The value of percent number of sensor failures.

concept.name: units_of_measure
concept.description: The units of measure for percent number of sensor failures.

concept.name: comment
concept.description: Any additional comment or clarification about the monitoring detail. For example the person's reason given for missing data or sensor failure.

concept.name: monitoring_data
concept.description: The glucose monitoring data for the reporting period. This includes capillary or venous blood and interstitial fluid data measured by blood glucose meter or continuous glucose monitoring (CGM) devices respectively.

concept.name: mean_glucose
concept.description: The mean glucose during the reporting period.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for mean glucose.

concept.name: value
concept.description: The value of mean glucose.

concept.name: units_of_measure
concept.description: The units of measure for mean glucose.

concept.name: glycaemic_variability_indexes
concept.description: Indexes of glycaemic variability.

concept.name: standard_deviation
concept.description: The standard deviation of mean glucose during the reporting period.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for standard deviation.

concept.name: value
concept.description: The value of standard deviation.

concept.name: units_of_measure
concept.description: The units of measure for standard deviation.

concept.name: coefficient_of_variation_cv
concept.description: The coefficient of variation (%CV) during the reporting period.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for coefficient of variation (%CV).

concept.name: value
concept.description: The value of coefficient of variation (%CV).

concept.name: units_of_measure
concept.description: The units of measure for coefficient of variation (%CV).

concept.name: time_or_values_in_range
concept.description: Details of the proportion of values or time spent in various target glycaemic ranges as a percentage, during the reporting period.

concept.name: time_or_values_above_range_tvar
concept.description: The proportion of values or time above the target glycaemic range as a percentage, during the reporting period.

concept.name: tvar_level_2
concept.description: The proportion of values or time above the target glycaemic range as a percentage (level 2).

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for T/VAR level 2.

concept.name: value
concept.description: The value of T/VAR level 2.

concept.name: units_of_measure

concept.name: reference_range
concept.description: The reference range for time or values above range level 2 (T/VAR level 2).

concept.description: This is the lower bound of the reference range.

concept.name: units_of_measure

concept.name: glucose_management_indicator_gmi
concept.description: Estimate of HbA1c using glucose management indicator (GMI), during the reporting period.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for glucose management indicator (GMI).

concept.name: value
concept.description: The value of glucose management indicator (GMI).

concept.name: units_of_measure
concept.description: The units of measure for glucose management indicator (GMI).

concept.name: number_of_significant_hypoglycaemic_episodes
concept.description: The number of significant hypoglycaemic episodes.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for number of significant hypoglycaemic episodes.

concept.name: value
concept.description: The value of number of significant hypoglycaemic episodes.

concept.name: mean_duration_of_hypoglycaemic_episodes
concept.description: The average duration of the person's hypoglycaemic episodes, during the reporting period.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for mean duration of hypoglycaemic episodes.

concept.name: value
concept.description: The value of mean duration of hypoglycaemic episodes.

concept.name: units_of_measure
concept.description: The units of measure for mean duration of hypoglycaemic episodes.

concept.name: standard_deviation
concept.description: The standard deviation of mean duration of hypoglycaemic episodes. This is equal to the square root of the variance.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for standard deviation.

concept.name: value
concept.description: The value of standard deviation.

concept.name: units_of_measure
concept.description: The units of measure for standard deviation.

concept.name: sensor_failures_record_entry
concept.description: This is a sensor failure record entry. There may be 0 to many record entry/entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.

concept.name: date
concept.description: The date and time of the sensor failure.

concept.name: sensor_failure
concept.description: Sensor failure (may include failures within and after the 2 hour wait time post-insertion).

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for sensor failure.

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: assessments
concept.description: Details of the person's assessments

concept.name: assessments_record_entry
concept.description: This is the assessments record entry. There may be 0 to many record entry/entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.

concept.name: assessment_type
concept.description: The type of the assessment e.g. social care needs assessment.

concept.name: assessment_summary
concept.description: The summary of the assessment

concept.name: structured_assessment
concept.description: Details of the structured assessment.

concept.name: structured_assessment_name
concept.description: Structured assessment name e.g. New York Heart Failure, Glasgow Coma scale, Activities of Daily Living (ADL) etc.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for structured assessment name.

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: assessment_result
concept.description: The structured assessment result. This is the overall result for the assessment.

concept.name: assessment_score
concept.description: The overall structured assessment score.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for assessment score.

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: value
concept.description: The numerical value for the assessment result.
concept.valueSets: Enumerated value e.g. numeric, natural numbers. This field is mandatory if the observable entity for assessment item is used.

concept.name: units_of_measure
concept.description: The units of measure for the assessment result.

concept.name: ordinal
concept.description: The ordinal result of the assessment e.g. mild, moderate, severe.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for the ordinal result.

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: subscale_result
concept.description: The subscale result for the structured assessment. This includes the result for individual questions or subsections.

concept.name: subscale_score
concept.description: The subscale score of the structured assessment. Subscales may be individual questions or subsections of the overall assessment.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for subscale item.

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: value
concept.description: The numerical value for the subscale assessment result.
concept.valueSets: Enumerated value e.g. numeric, natural numbers. This field is mandatory if the observable entity for subscale score is used.

concept.name: units_of_measure
concept.description: The units of measure for the assessment subscale result.

concept.name: ordinal
concept.description: The ordinal result of the subscale assessment e.g. mild, moderate, severe.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for the ordinal result.

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: comment
concept.description: Supporting text may be given regarding the assessment.

concept.name: medications_and_medical_devices
concept.description: Medications and medical devices

concept.name: medication_administration_record_entry
concept.description: Each entry holds details of medications administered

concept.name: medication_name
concept.description: May be generic name or brand name.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for medication name
concept.valueSets: dm+d:- any code from the VTM, VMP, AMP, VMPP and AMPP concept classes

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: method
concept.description: The technique or method by which the medication is to be administered.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for method
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT : - ^999000041000001103 | ePrescribing method simple reference set (foundation metadata concept) |

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no coded text available

concept.name: route
concept.description: The route by which the medication is administered e.g. oral, IM, IV

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for route
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT: - ^999000051000001100 |ePrescribing route of administration simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)|

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: site
concept.description: The anatomical site at which the medication was administered.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for site
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT: - <442083009 | Anatomical or acquired body structure (body structure) |

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used when code is not available

concept.name: device_type
concept.description: The device type.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for device type.

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: dose_context
concept.description: Supporting information about the dose administered e.g., carbohydrate coverage or high blood sugar correction insulin dose.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for dose context.

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: dose_administered
concept.description: Details of dose administered.

concept.name: value
concept.description: The value for dose administered.

concept.name: units_of_measure
concept.description: The units of measure for dose administered.

concept.name: administration_date_and_time
concept.description: The date and time when the medication was administered.

concept.name: start_datetime
concept.description: The date and time that the infusion started.

concept.name: end_datetime
concept.description: The date and time that the infusion ended.

concept.name: time_of_day
concept.description: The time of day the dose was administered e.g. morning/ afternoon or breakfast/ lunch/ evening meal/ other.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for time of day.

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available.

concept.name: priming_dose_indicator
concept.description: Indication of whether the dose delivered was a priming dose.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for priming dose indicator.

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: insulin_calculations_cluster
concept.description: Details relevant to the person's bolus insulin calculations for the dose administered.

concept.name: insulin_advisory_software
concept.description: Indication of whether the person was using an automated insulin delivery (AID) system or bolus advisor to calculate bolus dose.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for insulin advisory software.

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: blood_glucose
concept.description: The person's measured blood glucose.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for blood glucose.

concept.name: value
concept.description: The value of blood glucose.

concept.name: units_of_measure
concept.description: The units of measure for blood glucose.

concept.name: date
concept.description: The date and time of the blood glucose reading.

concept.name: carbohydrate_intake
concept.description: The person's carbohydrate intake at the meal for which the bolus dose was given (e.g. breakfast, lunch, evening meal or other times (e.g. snacks)).

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for carbohydrate intake.
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT.

concept.name: value
concept.description: The value of carbohydrate intake.

concept.name: units_of_measure
concept.description: The units of measure for carbohydrate intake.

concept.name: insulin_carbohydrate_ratio
concept.description: The person's insulin carbohydrate ratio (ICR) used to calculate the bolus dose administered. This includes entries for the ICR at breakfast, lunch, evening meal, or other times.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for insulin carbohydrate ratio.
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT.

concept.name: value
concept.description: The value of insulin carbohydrate ratio.

concept.name: units_of_measure
concept.description: The units of measure for insulin carbohydrate ratio.

concept.name: insulin_sensitivity_factor
concept.description: The person's insulin sensitivity factor (ISF) used to calculate the bolus dose administered. This includes entries for the ISF at breakfast, lunch, evening meal, or other times.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for insulin sensitivity factor.

concept.name: value
concept.description: The value of insulin sensitivity factor.

concept.name: units_of_measure
concept.description: The units of measure for insulin sensitivity factor.

concept.name: correction_target
concept.description: The person's correction target for the bolus dose administered. This includes entries for the correction target for breakfast, lunch, evening meal, or other times.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for correction target.
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT.

concept.name: value
concept.description: The value of correction target.

concept.name: units_of_measure
concept.description: The units of measure for correction target.

concept.name: comment
concept.description: Any additional comment or clarification about the medication administration.

concept.name: usual_insulin_dosing_cluster
concept.description: Details of the person's usual insulin dosing regimen.

concept.name: insulin_regimen
concept.description: The person's usual insulin regimen.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for insulin regimen.

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: usual_insulin_record_entry
concept.description: This is a usual insulin record entry. There may be 0 to many record entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.

concept.name: insulin_name
concept.description: The insulin name. May only be a brand name.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for insulin name.
concept.valueSets: dm+d:- any insulin code from the actual medicinal product (AMP) concept class.

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: device_type
concept.description: The device type.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for device type.

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: dose_context
concept.description: Supporting information about the dose administered e.g., carbohydrate coverage or high blood sugar correction insulin dose.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for dose context.
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT.

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: usual_insulin_dose
concept.description: Details of the person's usual dose for the named insulin by time of day. e.g. 1 international unit of a premixed insulin at breakfast time.

concept.name: value
concept.description: The value of usual insulin dose.

concept.name: units_of_measure
concept.description: The units of measure for usual insulin dose.

concept.name: time_of_day
concept.description: The time of day the dose is usually administered e.g. morning/ afternoon or breakfast/ lunch/ evening meal/ other.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for time of day.

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available.

concept.name: usual_bolus_calculations
concept.description:
Details of the the person's usual bolus insulin calculations including use of insulin advisory software.<br clear="none"/>
                                <br clear="none"/>

concept.name: uses_insulin_advisory_software
concept.description: Indication of whether the person uses an automated insulin delivery (AID) system or bolus advisor to calculate the bolus dose.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for uses insulin advisory software.

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: usual_carbohydrate_intake
concept.description: The person's usual carbohydrate intake by time of day. e.g. usual carbohydrate intake at breakfast.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for usual carbohydrate intake.
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT.

concept.name: value
concept.description: The value of usual carbohydrate intake.

concept.name: units_of_measure
concept.description: The units of measure for usual carbohydrate intake.
concept.valueSets: UCUM code.

concept.name: usual_insulin_carbohydrate_ratio
concept.description: The person's usual insulin : carbohydrate ratio (ICR) calculated for a carbohydrate coverage insulin dose by time of day. e.g. usual ICR at breakfast. International units of insulin per 10 gram carbohydrate portion. <br clear="none"/>

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for usual insulin carbohydrate ratio.
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT.

concept.name: value
concept.description: The value of usual insulin carbohydrate ratio.

concept.name: units_of_measure
concept.description: The units of measure for usual insulin carbohydrate ratio.

concept.name: usual_insulin_sensitivity_factor
concept.description:
The person's usual insulin sensitivity factor (ISF) calculated for a high blood sugar correction insulin dose by time of day. e.g. usual ISF at breakfast. The ISF is the expected glucose fall (in mmol/L) per one additional international until of insulin.<br clear="none"/>
                                    <br clear="none"/>
                                    <br clear="none"/>

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for usual insulin sensitivity factor.
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT.

concept.name: value
concept.description: The value of usual insulin sensitivity factor.

concept.name: units_of_measure
concept.description: The units of measure for usual insulin sensitivity factor.

concept.name: usual_correction_target
concept.description: The person's usual correction target for a high blood sugar correction insulin dose by time of day. e.g. usual correction target at breakfast.<br clear="none"/>

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for usual correction target.
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT.

concept.name: value
concept.description: The value of usual correction target.

concept.name: units_of_measure
concept.description: The units of measure for usual correction target.

concept.name: summary_medication_metrics
concept.description: Summary metrics for medication administered.

concept.name: insulin_metrics_record_entry
concept.description: This is an insulin metrics record entry. There may be 0 to many record entry/entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.

concept.name: reporting_period
concept.description: The reporting period for the person's insulin dosing data.

concept.name: start_date
concept.description: The start date and time of the data sample period.

concept.name: end_date
concept.description: The end date and time of the data sample period.

concept.name: device_data_record_entry
concept.description: This is a device data record entry. There may be 0 to many record entry/entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.

concept.name: device_type
concept.description: The device type.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for device type.

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: device_use_period
concept.description: Details of the device use period.

concept.name: use_start_date
concept.description: The start date and time of device use.

concept.name: use_end_date
concept.description: The end date and time of device use.

concept.name: device_closed_loop
concept.description: Details of time spent in closed loop during the device use period.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for device closed loop.

concept.name: start_datetime
concept.description: The date and time that the closed loop started.

concept.name: end_datetime
concept.description: The date and time that the closed loop ended.

concept.name: device_suspension
concept.description: Details of time spent in manual or low glucose suspend (insulin pump) during the device use period.

concept.description: The coded value for device suspension.

concept.name: start_datetime
concept.description: The date and time that the manual or low glucose suspend started.

concept.name: end_datetime
concept.description: The date and time that the manual or low glucose suspend ended.

concept.name: device_cannula_change
concept.description: Details of cannula changes during the device use period.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for device cannula change.

concept.name: cannula_change_date_and_time
concept.description: The date and time when the cannula was changed.

concept.name: device_summary_metrics
concept.description: Details of device summary metrics applicable across the reporting period.

concept.name: percent_device_data_available
concept.description: The device data available as a percentage of that expected during the reporting period.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for percent device data available.

concept.name: value
concept.description: The value of percent device data available.

concept.name: units_of_measure
concept.description: The units of measure for percent device data available.

concept.name: percent_time_in_closed_loop
concept.description: The time in closed loop as a percentage of the reporting period.

concept.description: The coded value for percent time in closed loop.

concept.description: The value of percent time in closed loop.

concept.name: units_of_measure
concept.description: The units of measure for percent time in closed loop.

concept.description: The time in low glucose or manual suspend as a percentage the reporting period.

concept.description: The coded value for percent time in suspend.

concept.description: The value of percent time in suspend.

concept.name: units_of_measure
concept.description: The units of measure for percent time in suspend.

concept.description: The number of episodes of insulin delivery suspend lasting longer than 60 minutes across the reporting period.

concept.description: The coded value for number of episodes of suspend greater than 60 minutes.

concept.name: value
concept.description: The value for number of episodes of suspend greater than 60 minutes.

concept.name: mean_time_between_cannula_changes

concept.description: The coded value for mean time between cannula changes.

concept.description: The units of measure for total daily basal dose (mean).

concept.name: standard_deviation
concept.description: The standard deviation of total daily basal dose (mean). This is equal to the square root of the variance.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for standard deviation.

concept.name: value
concept.description: The value of standard deviation.

concept.name: units_of_measure
concept.description: The units of measure for standard deviation.

concept.name: total_daily_bolus_dose_mean
concept.description: The person's mean total daily bolus insulin dose across the reporting period.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for total daily bolus dose (mean).

concept.name: value
concept.description: The value of total daily bolus dose (mean).

concept.name: units_of_measure
concept.description: The units of measure for total daily bolus dose (mean).

concept.name: standard_deviation
concept.description: The standard deviation of total daily bolus dose (mean). This is equal to the square root of the variance.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for standard deviation.

concept.name: value
concept.description: The value of standard deviation.

concept.name: units_of_measure
concept.description: The units of measure for standard deviation.

concept.name: number_of_boluses_per_day_mean
concept.description: The person's mean number of insulin boluses per day across the reporting period.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for number of boluses per day (mean).
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT.

concept.name: value
concept.description: The value of number of boluses per day (mean).

concept.name: standard_deviation
concept.description: The standard deviation for number of boluses per day (mean).

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for standard deviation.

concept.name: value
concept.description: The value of standard deviation.

concept.name: modal_insulin_record_entry
concept.description: This is a modal insulin record entry. There may be 0 to many record entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.

concept.name: insulin_name
concept.description: The insulin name. May only be a brand name.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for insulin name.
concept.valueSets: dm+d:- any insulin code from the actual medicinal product (AMP) concept class.

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: device_type
concept.description: The device type.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for device type.

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: dose_context
concept.description: Supporting information about the dose administered e.g., carbohydrate coverage or high blood sugar correction insulin dose.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for dose context.
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT.

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: modal_insulin_dose
concept.description: Details of the person's modal dose for the named insulin by time of day. e.g. 1 international unit of a basal insulin delivered by connected insulin pen at breakfast time.

concept.name: value
concept.description: The value of modal insulin dose.

concept.name: units_of_measure
concept.description: The units of measure for modal insulin dose.

concept.name: time_of_day
concept.description: The time of day the modal dose applies to e.g. morning/ afternoon or breakfast/ lunch/ evening meal/ other.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for time of day.

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available.

concept.name: modal_bolus_calculations
concept.description: Details of the the person's modal bolus insulin calculations. Sourced from devices running insulin advisory software e.g. Automated insulin delivery (AID) system or bolus advisor.<br clear="none"/>

concept.name: modal_carbohydrate_intake
concept.description: The person's modal carbohydrate intake by time of day. e.g. modal carbohydrate intake at breakfast.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for modal carbohydrate intake.
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT.

concept.name: value
concept.description: The value of modal carbohydrate intake.

concept.name: units_of_measure
concept.description: The units of measure for modal carbohydrate intake.
concept.valueSets: UCUM code.

concept.name: modal_insulin_carbohydrate_ratio
concept.description: The person's modal insulin : carbohydrate ratio (ICR) calculated for a carbohydrate coverage insulin dose by time of day. e.g. usual ICR at breakfast. International units of insulin per 10 gram carbohydrate portion. <br clear="none"/>

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for modal insulin carbohydrate ratio.
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT.

concept.name: value
concept.description: The value of modal insulin carbohydrate ratio.

concept.name: units_of_measure
concept.description: The units of measure for modal insulin carbohydrate ratio.

concept.name: modal_insulin_sensitivity_factor
concept.description: The person's modal insulin sensitivity factor (ISF) calculated for a high blood sugar correction insulin dose by time of day. e.g. usual ISF at breakfast. The ISF is the expected glucose fall (in mmol/L) per one additional international until of insulin.<br clear="none"/>

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for modal insulin sensitivity factor.
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT.

concept.name: value
concept.description: The value of modal insulin sensitivity factor.

concept.name: units_of_measure
concept.description: The units of measure for modal insulin sensitivity factor.

concept.name: modal_correction_target
concept.description: The person's modal correction target for a high blood sugar correction insulin dose by time of day. e.g. modal correction target at breakfast.<br clear="none"/>

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for modal correction target.
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT.

concept.name: value
concept.description: The value of modal correction target.

concept.name: units_of_measure
concept.description: The units of measure for modal correction target.

concept.name: medication_item_entry
concept.description: All medications and devices that can be prescribed to be entered via this Medication item entry. Handles details of continuation / addition / amendment of admission medications.

concept.name: medical_devices_entry
concept.description: Medical devices

concept.name: medical_device
concept.description: Details of a medical device used by the person.

concept.name: device_type
concept.description: The device type.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for device type.

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available.

concept.name: device_manufacturer
concept.description: Name of the device manufacturer.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for device manufacturer.

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: model
concept.description: The model of the device.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for model.

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: software_version
concept.description: The version of software running on the device.

concept.name: unique_identifier
concept.description: The unique identifier for the device.

concept.name: provision_date
concept.description: Date the device was provided to the person.

concept.name: replacement_date
concept.description: Date the device is due for replacement or was replaced.

concept.name: warranty_details
concept.description: Details about the warranty for the device.

concept.name: comments
concept.description: Any information regarding the medical device.

concept.name: documents_including_correspondence_audio_and_images
concept.description: Details about documents related to the person.

concept.name: documents
concept.description: This is the documents record entry. There may be 0 to many record entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.

concept.name: documentation_location
concept.description: The location of the document

concept.name: confidentiality
concept.description: The code specifying the level of confidentiality of the document.

concept.name: class
concept.description: The document type e.g. report, summary, images, treatment plan, patient preferences, workflow

concept.name: document_title
concept.description: The title of the document.

concept.name: document_name
concept.description:
The name of the document. This should align to the PRSB document naming standard. Where the document is a KOS document this field (designated typeCode) is used to carry the DICOM Imaging procedure: This attribute shall be populated by the XDS-I Imaging Document Source from a code in the Procedure Code Sequence (0008,1032) of the performed procedure
                            with which the document is associated. Values may be found in a suitable DICOM browser
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT: - As per the https://theprsb.org/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/Clinical-document-indexing-standards_NHS-Scotland.pdf

concept.name: document_mime_type
concept.description: MIME type of the document e.g. application, pdf, audio, jpeg

concept.name: comments
concept.description: Comments associated with the document.

concept.name: additional_information_required_for_images
concept.description: Additional information required for images.

concept.name: image_procedure
concept.description: The procedure used to capture the image
concept.valueSets:
Free text
Using DICOM code set https://dicom.innolitics.com/ciods

concept.name: image_procedure_date
concept.description: The date and time the image procedure was performed.

concept.name: images
concept.description: Images details.

concept.name: image_capture_date
concept.description: The date and time when the image was captured.

concept.name: image_id
concept.description: A unique image identifier generated by the system.

concept.name: image_location
concept.description: The URL for the image

concept.name: format_code
concept.description: The format code of the document which provides information on how to display the document.

concept.name: event_code_list
concept.description: The type of image (acquisition modality) and the anatomical site imaged.

concept.name: comments
concept.description: Comments associated with the imaging
